page.title: 12HILLHEAD QUARRY
page.content: {Hillhead Quarry, Uffculme}belongs to {English China Clays (E.C.C.) Ltd.}and was opened in{1963. Twenty people}are employed here and most of their orders come from construction sites within a twenty mile radius of Uffculme. The{materials quarried}are concrete aggregate and fine and coarse sand. Just at present there are no big contracts but in the recent past this quarry has supplied materials for the following: The{M5 Motorway}from Bristol to Cullompton, Hinkley Point Nuclear Power Station, Wimbleball and Meldon Reserviors.There are no plans to increase production but excavation inevitably moves to new sites as the old ones are reinstated. E.C.C. own enough ground to continue quarrying on this site for{many years.}There is speculation that a{Council Tip}may be sited here and this is{not popular!
